Founded in 2014, InstaDeep is today an EMEA leader in decision-making AI products for the Enterprise, with headquarters in London, and offices in Paris, Berlin, Tunis, Lagos, Dubai, Cape Town and the USA. InstaDeep has been named among the Top 100 global AI startups for three consecutive years by CB Insights, as well as one of the 100 most promising B2B companies in Europe, by Sifted. We have created an environment that ensures a challenge by working closely with a broad spectrum of high-quality clients, pushing you to thrive in an environment that’s rarely tedious and always looking to push you to come up with outside-the-box solutions using cutting-edge technologies. In our mission to stay ahead of the curve, we are proud to partner with firms such as BioNTech SE, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA and Intel, and world-class universities such as MIT, Oxford, UCL, and Imperial College London. We are also an NVIDIA Elite Service Delivery Partner and Google Cloud Partner.

Are you a Machine... Learning Engineer? At InstaDeep, the focus of a Research Engineer (RE) is on implementing the most innovative AI or cognitive computing technologies in order to solve identified business problems and help in the execution of technologies for commercial deployment. The RE’s goal is to develop and implement state-of-the-art algorithms while building simple and sustainable software solutions. Among the tasks they are responsible for are: working on novel research ideas, developing prototype applications, providing software design and implementing software libraries. In this role at InstaDeep, you will report to a Senior Research Engineer.

If so then keep reading….

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll be a part of the Engineering department,

The Machine Learning Engineer must accomplish the following:
• Develop novel algorithms and research ideas in machine learning.
• Write software to connect the algorithms to the real world.
• Investigate and analyse why a model makes the predictions that it does.
• Collaborate with different teams and stakeholders, both internal and external to the company.
• Report and present experimental results and research findings clearly and efficiently, both internally and externally, orally and in writing in English.

Requirements:
• B.S./M.S./Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Operational Research, Machine Learning, or related field.
• Experience in developing and debugging in C/C++ and/or Python or similar languages.
• Experience using deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, Jax, and/or Keras.
• Proficiency with Git workflow, and development with best coding practices.
• Research and software engineering experience demonstrated via an internship, contributions to open source, work experience, or coding competitions.
• By applying you confirm you can demonstrate that you have the right to work in South Africa.

Nice to haves:
• Experience in performing innovative research in applied machine learning and artificial intelligence.
• Experience in Explainable AI (XAI).
• Experience with Machine Learning tools for geospatial analysis.

Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion commitments

We empower individuals to celebrate their uniqueness here at InstaDeep. Our team comes from all walks of life, and we’re proud to continue encouraging and supporting applicants from underrepresented groups across the globe. Our commitment to creating an authentic environment comes from our ability to learn and grow from our diversity, and how better to experience this by other than by joining our team?

At present we operate in a hybrid way allowing work from home or work from the office as per each individual’s preferences. We are continuing to review the situation with the well-being of InstaDeepers at the forefront of our minds.

Right to work: Please note you will require the legal right to work in the location you are applying for.

Any further questions please do not hesitate to contact us at: talent@instadeep.com

Job-Title: Machine Learning Advocate Engineer - Africa Remote
Description:
Here at Hugging Face, we’re on a journey to advance good Machine Learning and make it more accessible. Along the way, we contribute to the development of technology for the better.

We have built the fastest-growing, open-source, library of pre-trained models in the world. With over 100M+ installs and 65K+ stars on GitHub, over 10 thousand companies are using HF technology in production, including leading AI organizations such as Google, Elastic, Salesforce, Algolia, and Grammarly.

About the Role

As a Machine Learning Advocate Engineer for Africa, you will have a key role in driving the adoption of the Hub platform and Open Source technologies by creating, fostering and growing communities, extending the use cases of the Hub, developing tools to improve the developer experience, and bringing feedback to the team. You’ll collaborate extremely closely with both the Open Source, Science and Product teams.

This is not a marketing position! Developer Advocacy at Hugging Face is deeply... technical and having a generalist mindset is essential. Our team contributes to libraries such as Transformers and Datasets, as well as external libraries, and being able to technically collaborate with the rest of the team is essential.

We value that each team member works on impactful projects that are interesting to them. As such, you’ll have a key part in defining your role and day-to-day activities. Depending on your interests, you could work on developing tools to expand the Hub to new domains such as Reinforcement Learning or Computer Vision in a week and craft blog posts, videos, talks and demos the next one.

About you

You'll love working here if you enjoy both developing your Machine Learning skills and amplifying your impact by engaging with the ecosystem. If you can spend Monday coding, Tuesday designing a workshop, Wednesday writing a blog post and Thursday crafting ML memes, this job opening is for you!

We are growing a team with diverse backgrounds and skills, and hence being proficient in other human languages and having deep connections with your local ecosystem is a strong bonus. Having experience in Open Source development is a huge bonus. Existing engagement in different platforms (GitHub, LinkedIn, Twitter, TikTok, Reddit, etc) is also a bonus but not required.

If you're interested in joining us, but don't tick every box above, we still encourage you to apply! We're building a diverse team whose skills, experiences, and backgrounds complement one another. We're happy to consider where you might be able to make the biggest impact.

More about Hugging Face

We are actively working to build a culture that values diversity, equity, and inclusivity. We are intentionally building a workplace where people feel respected and supported—regardless of who you are or where you come from. We believe this is foundational to building a great company and community. Hugging Face is an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We value development. You will work with some of the smartest people in our industry. We are an organization that has a bias for impact and is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. We provide all employees with reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.

We care about your well-being. We offer flexible working hours and remote options. We offer health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents. We also offer parental leave and unlimited paid time off.

We support our employees wherever they are. While we have office spaces in NYC and Paris, we’re very distributed and all remote employees have the opportunity to visit our offices. If needed, we’ll also outfit your workstation to ensure you succeed.

We want our teammates to be shareholders. All employees have company equity as part of their compensation package. If we succeed in becoming a category-defining platform in machine learning and artificial intelligence, everyone enjoys the upside.

We support the community. We believe major scientific advancements are the result of collaboration across the field. Join a community supporting the ML/AI community

Introduction

Kubevisor GmbH is a big data and machine learning development company that builds end-to-end projects for large German clients. You can find out more about us at https://www.kubevisor.com .

Our project teams are fully remote, with optional travel to Germany.

We are currently looking for ML engineers to join our team that are interested in being involved in full stack projects in the context of machine learning projects.

Description

A successful candidate will be a person who enjoys diving deep into data, doing analysis, discovering root causes, and designing long-term solutions. It will be a person that wants to innovate in the world of cloud big data engineering and machine learning.

Major responsibilities include:
• Understand the client's business need and guide them to a solution using Python, PyTorch, Kubeflow, Kubernetes, AWS etc.
• Lead the customer projects by being able to deliver a machine learning project on AWS from beginning to end, including... understanding the business need, aggregating data, exploring data, training models and deploying to AWS (EKS, S3 etc..) to deliver business impact to the organization.

Basic Qualifications
• Degree in computer science or a similar field
• 2+ years relevant work experience
• Able to use a major programming, preferably Python

Beneficial Experience
• Experience in processing large datasets on AWS
• Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets
• Combination of deep technical skills and business savvy enough to interface with all levels and disciplines within our client's organization
• Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
• Python to process data for modelling
• Experience working with a wide range of predictive and decision models, including tools
• ML workflow tools (e.g. Kubeflow/MLflow)
• Developing end-to-end software projects
• Experience using Linux to process large data sets
• Experience with Kubernetes
• Experience with AWS

Candidates do not have to be an exact match for the above, main criteria is Linux experience combined with software development

Senior Data Engineer We are looking for an innovative, collaborative, intellectually curious and entrepreneurial Senior Data Scientist to join our Enterprise Data and Analytics team. This is an exciting opportunity to join a newly created fast-moving start-up style group within one of the world's leading human data science companies. The primary focus of the role is to develop advanced analytics on highly complex, large-scale internal company data to identify potential efficiencies and improvements.

A typical day might include

Working with the team and client to develop reporting and analytical needs

Addressing those requirements by developing and applying appropriate processes and methodologies

Communicating technical concepts and analytical outputs to a diverse set of stakeholders

Proactively identifying opportunities for innovation and areas for improvement across the company

Responsibilities:

Gathering, cleaning, and processing data Developing tools and processes to monitor... and analyse data accuracy

Collaborating with organizational leaders to identify informational needs

Analysing data sets to spot trends and patterns that can be translated into actionable insights

Presenting findings in an easy-to-understand way to inform data-driven decisions

Designing descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive models, and machine learning algorithms to mine big data sets

Qualifications Bachelor's Degree Computer Science or related discipline, or knowledge acquired through equivalent experience required

Advanced working knowledge of SQL required, Python requirement, Alteryx is advantage

Machine learning, data modelling experience

Advanced statistic, predictive analytics

Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

Strong written and verbal communication skills

however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted
